forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear. Low around 56, with temperatures rising to around 58 overnight. North northwest wind around 10 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 75, with temperatures falling to around 73 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
In the quiet hours of the early morning, a clear sky blankets Downtown San Francisco, as if casting a serene shroud over the bustling city's usual fervor. The overnight chill settles around 56 degrees, gradually inched upwards by the cool north-northwest breeze, which whispers promises of a delightful day ahead. The daybreak reveals an inviting sight, devoid of fog obscuring the horizons, allowing glimmers of sunlight to break through, hinting at a canvas of warmth drifting in with the rising sun.

As Monday unfolds, the sun will graciously climb to near 75 degrees, painting the day in golden hues that beckon you outdoors. With wind chimes clinking gently and a faint rustle of leaves in the air, it feels like the city is orchestrating its timeless symphony. Dress in layers—perhaps a light sweater over a t-shirt to gracefully navigate the shifting temperatures, for the afternoon may dip into cooler notes. A stroll along the waterfront or a leisurely visit to the flowering gardens in the park becomes a perfect pastime, allowing one to soak in the beauty of a sunlit day without the encumbrance of heavy attire or thick fog. Enjoy the clarity and warmth; the charm of San Francisco is alive and radiant today, inviting all who wander to revel in its embrace.
